page.title: 03THE ALLOTMENTS
page.content: The{Allotments}lie along the edge of REDDISH VALE COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL's playing fields. The{council owns}the land and have divided it into plots.If a person wants to have an allotment he sees Mr.Flowers the secretary of the allotments about it. People{grow various kinds of{vegetables and {flowers}on their allotments, because there is no tap water people have to depend on the rain to water their plants. one man we spoke to was making some hives ready for some bees. There are quite{a few animals}on the allotments; goats, pigeons, hens and geese. One man kept his pigeons for racing. People say the allotments have been there for many years. The allotments were used to sell vegatables but only a few people sell vegatables or fruit now.
